intro: Phacelia cryptantha var. typica, commonly known as the Sierra phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
